headline.seo: Food Pyramid Being Replaced With Plate-Shaped Logo
headline.print_headline: Goodbye to the Food Pyramid, Hello to the Dinner Plate
headline.main: Goodbye Food Pyramid, Hello Dinner Plate

docs.lead_paragraph: The new symbol, a plate, is meant to give consumers a fast, simple reminder of the basics of a healthy diet.
docs.snippet: The new symbol, a plate, is meant to give consumers a fast, simple reminder of the basics of a healthy diet.

headline.print_headline: Under an Arizona Plan, Smokers and Obese Would Pay Fee for Medicaid
headline.main: Under an Arizona Plan, Smokers and Obese Would Pay Fee for Medicaid

docs.lead_paragraph: The state would like charge childless adults on Medicaid who smoke or are obese $50. “What we want to test is whether making people pay is going to affect behavior,” said a spokeswoman for Arizona’s Medicaid program. “We think it will.”
docs.snippet: The state would like charge childless adults on Medicaid who smoke or are obese $50. “What we want to test is whether making people pay is going to affect behavior,” said a spokeswoman for Arizona’s Medicaid program. “We think it will.”

headline.seo: Workplace Cited as a New Source of Rise in Obesity
headline.print_headline: SEDENTARY WORK CITED AS FACTOR IN RISING OBESITY
headline.main: Workplace Cited as a New Source of Rise in Obesity

docs.lead_paragraph: As workers moved from farms and factories to desks over the last half-century, calories have been piling up: about 120 to 140 a day, a new study has found.
docs.snippet: As workers moved from farms and factories to desks over the last half-century, calories have been piling up: about 120 to 140 a day, a new study has found.

headline.main: Less Active at Work, Americans Have Packed on Pounds

docs.abstract: As workers moved from farms and factories to desks over the last half-century, calories have been piling up: about 120 to 140 a day, a new study has found.
docs.lead_paragraph: Looking beyond poor eating habits and a couch-potato lifestyle, a group of researchers has found a new culprit in the obesity epidemic: the American workplace.
docs.snippet: As workers moved from farms and factories to desks over the last half-century, calories have been piling up: about 120 to 140 a day, a new study has found.

headline.main: Does It All Come Down to Medicare?

byline.original: By DAVID BROOKS AND GAIL COLLINS

docs.abstract: In the 2012 presidential election, the Democrats will try to address the fiscal problems without touching the elderly or the middle class, while the Republicans will focus on tax revenue. No matter how you slice the issue, it’s voodoo policy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gail Collins: David, this is going to be our last conversation until after Labor Day. I’m already nostalgic — we’ve been doing this for almost three years to the day, and this will be our first real break. I’ve been remembering all our fun times — like how plucky you were about finding ways to communicate during severe power outages — which, I must point out, seem to follow you around the country. And the night the Republicans won the Ted Kennedy Senate seat and I carried on my half of the conversation by e-mail while curled up in a fetal position under a hotel bed.
docs.snippet: In the 2012 presidential election, the Democrats will try to address the fiscal problems without touching the elderly or the middle class, while the Republicans will focus on tax revenue. No matter how you slice the issue, it’s voodoo policy.
